Could the first Lakers trade under the Magic Johnson regime be in the works? 
Lou Williams will almost certainly be dealt this week. The question is where. Reports now indicate the veteran guard could wind up in Charlotte. 
MORE: Bad Magic Johnson NBA hot takes 
The Hornets are "aggressively pursuing" Williams, according to ESPN.com . Williams, in his 11th NBA season on his fourth team, is averaging 18.6 points and 3.2 assists in just over 24 minutes per game this season. It's the highest scoring average of his career, by more than three points per game. 
Should a trade to Charlotte be consummated in the next two days, it's not known what the Lakers might receive in return. 
The Hornets are also said to be interested in Nets forward Bojan Bogdanovic. 
Williams reportedly has other suitors in the Jazz, Magic, Wizards and Bulls. 
Johnson had been a team adviser before getting promoted Tuesday to president of basketball operations. He replaces Jim Buss and will also serve as the team's interim general manager with the Lakers also firing GM Mitch Kupchak on Tuesday. 
Johnson spent his entire 13-year playing career with the Lakers, helping to lead them to five NBA championships. He also spent 16 games as the team's interim coach in 1994, going 5-11. Read This
